posts.name: Sami Krichene
posts.cooked: Me and my team have came back from our first regional and we haven’t been using the VH-109s while we are testing in here until we have our VH-113 set up (Work in progress right now) and have been using the old open mesh radios. While they work fine for in here we want to set up the 113 and get it running. As the person who has been working on that process one of the main issues I’ve noticed is that the radio is not flashing and is still on the competition firmware. When I try to flash the radio its connected to power via a 117-POE adapter plugged into the “rio” port on the 109 and my computer is plugged in via the “ds” port on the radio. when I try to flash the 113 it also doesn’t do anything. I checked the cable using the built in cable tester on our managed switch and it said it should be fine. Just to be sure I switched the cable out and it still didn’t do anything. If anyone could offer suggestions that would be much appretiated.

posts.name: Shahar Zaibel
posts.cooked: Does the radio lights up? Can you look if network adapter is set to DHCP?

What do you mean by flash? Setting the team number, or updating the firmware?

If the radio lights are on, what is the light pattern? Are they blinking?

posts.name: Sami Krichene
posts.cooked: Flash as in set the team number, the wifi-passwords, and ssid suffix. The lights are on and they are flashing at 1 hertz, even after I click the configure button

posts.name: Sami Krichene
posts.cooked: The radio lights up and is receiving power fine If you mean the IP address of my computer it is set to 192.168.0.2

posts.name: Joseph Walters
posts.cooked:
Original Post:

Samcam2090:

one of the main issues I’ve noticed is that the radio is not flashing and is still on the competition firmware.

FYI: The firmware flashed at competition is the latest and does not need replacing as of today 3/14/2025 (v1.3.0).

Samcam2090:

when I try to flash the 113 it also doesn’t do anything.

Which firmware are you attempting to flash the VH-113, regular robot radio/AP, PRACTICE, or OFFSEASON?

Which network infrastructure are you attempting to replicate? Can you send a picture from Vivid-Hosting’s website?

Later Replies:

Samcam2090:

Flash as in set the team number, the wifi-passwords, and ssid suffix

I recommend you set your computers ethernet port to DHCP for this initial configuration.

Manually setting to 192.168.69.2 with a 255.255.255.0 network mask will also work until the team number and WPA key are set when you will want to undo this static configuration (it will still work for t he radio, but if you are using this as a driver-station laptop you will have trouble come competition time).

I made a video for you/others having trouble . There is similar information in shorter format available on vivid-hosting’s network assistant page

You also mention:

Samcam2090:

on our managed switch

I would recommend for troubleshooting taking this one step at a time and connecting directly your computer to the radio to be configured eliminating any in-between devices which may interfere, like a managed network switch if not properly configured.

link_counts.title: Network Assistant Tool | FIRST FRC Radio
Practicing At Home | FIRST FRC Radio
Setting VH-109 To Access Point Mode | FIRST FRC Radio

posts.name: Joseph Walters
posts.cooked:
Samcam2090:

my computer it is set to 192.168.0.2

This is likely the problem if it is a STATIC IP you set and the subnet mask is rather restrictive like 255.255.255.0. Although then you wouldent be able to reach the configuration page at all. See my above post and video.

Also turn off OTHER NETWORK INTERFACES like WIFI, it will make getting to the configuration page easier.
